original: 7. Bhikkhusaṅghapariharaṇapañha
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgha pariharaṇa pañha
translated: The Question about the Care of the Community of Monks

original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “Though, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, na evaṁ hoti “ahaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissāmī”ti vā, “mamuddesiko bhikkhusaṅgho”ti vā’ti.
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho ānanda na evam hoti aham bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi iti vā mamuddesikaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ iti vā ati
translated: ‘Ānanda, it does not occur to a Tathāgata that he will look after the community of monks or that the community of monks is dependent on him,’

original: Puna ca metteyyassa bhagavato sabhāvaguṇaṁ paridīpayamānena bhagavatā evaṁ bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: puna ca metteyyassa bhagavataḥ sabhāva guṇam paridīpayamānena bhagavatā evam bhaṇita
translated: yet again, when the Blessed One was extolling the special qualities of Metteyya, he said:

original: ‘so anekasahassaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissati, seyyathāpi ahaṁ etarahi anekasataṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharāmī’ti.
analyzed: saḥ aneka sahassam bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissati seyyathā api aham etarahi aneka satam bhikkhu saṅgham pariharāmi iti
translated: ‘He will look after the community of monks numbering many thousands, just as I now look after the community of monks numbering many hundreds.’

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: If, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, na evaṁ hoti “ahaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissāmī”ti vā,
analyzed: tathāgatassa kho ānanda na evam hoti aham bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi iti vā
translated: ‘Ānanda, it does not occur to a Tathāgata that he will look after the community of monks or that the community of monks is dependent on him,’

original: “mamuddesiko bhikkhusaṅgho”ti vā’ti, tena hi anekasataṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharāmīti🔽yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: mamuddesikaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ iti vāti tena hi aneka satam bhikkhu saṅgham pariharāmi iti  yam tam micchā
translated: then the statement ‘I now look after the community of monks numbering many hundreds’ is wrong.

original: Yadi tathāgatena bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: yadi tathāgatena bhaṇita
translated: If the Tathāgata said this:

original: ‘so anekasahassaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissati, seyyathāpi ahaṁ etarahi anekasataṁ🔽bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharāmī’ti, tena hi ‘tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, na evaṁ hoti “ahaṁ
analyzed: saḥ aneka sahassam bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissati seyyathā api aham etarahi aneka sata  bhikkhu saṅgham pariharāmi iti tena hi tathāgatassa kho ānanda na evam hoti aha
translated: ‘He will lead an Order of monks numbering several thousands, just as I do now an Order of monks numbering several hundreds,’ then this statement of yours is wrong,

original: bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissāmī”ti vā, “mamuddesiko bhikkhusaṅgho”ti vā’ti tampi vacanaṁ
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi iti vā mamuddesikaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ iti vā ati
translated: and this statement of the Blessed One is wrong.

original: micchā, ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: micchā ayam pi ubhatas koṭiko pañho tava an uppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This too is a double-pronged question, the fifth one now put to you, and you should answer it.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā ‘tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, na evaṁ hoti “ahaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissāmī”ti vā, “mamuddesiko bhikkhusaṅgho”ti vā’ti.
analyzed: bhāsitam peta mahā rāja bhagavatā tathāgatassa kho ānanda na evam hoti aham bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissāmi iti vā mamuddesikaḥ bhikkhu saṅghaḥ iti vā ati
translated: “Great king, this was said by the Blessed One: ‘Ānanda, it does not occur to a Tathāgata: “I will lead an Order of monks” or “An Order of monks is to be led by me.”’

original: Puna ca metteyyassāpi bhagavato sabhāvaguṇaṁ paridīpayamānena bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: puna ca metteyyassa api bhagavataḥ sabhāva guṇam paridīpayamānena bhagavatā bhaṇita
translated: But it was also said by the Blessed One, who was describing the inherent virtue of Metteyya,

original: ‘so anekasahassaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissati, seyyathāpi ahaṁ etarahi anekasataṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharāmī’ti.
analyzed: saḥ aneka sahassam bhikkhu saṅgham pariharissati seyyathā api aham etarahi aneka satam bhikkhu saṅgham pariharāmi iti
translated: ‘He will lead an Order of monks numbering several thousands, just as I do now an Order of monks numbering several hundreds.’

original: Etasmiñca, mahārāja, pañhe eko attho sāvaseso, eko attho niravaseso.
analyzed: etasmin ca mahā rāja pañhe ekaḥ attho sa avaseso ekaḥ attho niravaseso
translated: And in this question, sire, one meaning is incomplete and one meaning is complete.

original: Na, mahārāja, tathāgato parisāya anugāmiko, parisā pana tathāgatassa anugāmikā.
analyzed: na mahā rāja tathāgataḥ parisāya anugāmikaḥ parisā pana tathāgatassa anugāmikā
translated: The Tathāgata, sire, is not a follower of the assembly, but the assembly is a follower of the Tathāgata.

original: Sammuti, mahārāja, esā ‘ahan’ti ‘mamā’ti, na paramattho eso, vigataṁ, mahārāja, tathāgatassa
analyzed: sammuti mahā rāja esā ahanti mama ati na paramattho esaḥ vigata mahā rāja tathāgatassa
translated: This is a convention, sire, that ‘I’ and ‘mine’ are used, but this is not the ultimate meaning. The Tathāgata, sire, is free from

original: pemaṁ, vigato sineho, ‘mayhan’tipi tathāgatassa gahaṇaṁ natthi, upādāya pana avassayo hoti.
analyzed: vigataḥ sinehaḥ tathāgatassa gahaṇam natthi upādāya pana avassayaḥ hoti
translated: love, free from affection. The Tathāgata has no grasping at ‘mine.’ But he is a support for those who grasp.

original: Yathā, mahārāja, pathavī bhūmaṭṭhānaṁ sattānaṁ patiṭṭhā hoti upassayaṁ, pathaviṭṭhā cete sattā, na ca mahāpathaviyā ‘mayhete’ti apekkhā hoti;
analyzed: yathā mahā rāja pathavī bhūmaṭṭhānam sattānam patiṭṭhā hoti upassaya pathavi ṭṭhā ca ite sattā na ca mahā pathaviyā apekkhā hoti
translated: As, sire, the earth is a support and a refuge for beings who stand on the earth, and those beings are established on the earth, but the great earth has no expectation that ‘they are mine’;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, tathāgato sabbasattānaṁ patiṭṭhā hoti upassayaṁ, tathāgataṭṭhā cete sattā, na ca tathāgatassa ‘mayhete’ti apekkhā hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ sabba sattānam patiṭṭhā hoti upassaya tathāgata ṭṭhā ca ite sattā na ca tathāgatassa apekkhā hoti
translated: even so, sire, the Tathāgata is a support and a refuge for all beings, and those beings are established in the Tathāgata, but the Tathāgata has no expectation that ‘they are mine.’

original: Yathā vā pana, mahārāja, mahatimahāmegho abhivassanto tiṇarukkhapasumanussānaṁ vuḍḍhiṁ deti santatiṁ anupāleti.
analyzed: yathā vā pana mahā rāja mahati mahā meghaḥ abhivassantaḥ tiṇa rukkha pasu manussānam vuḍḍhim deti santatim anupāleti
translated: Or, sire, just as a great cloud pouring down rain gives growth to the grass, trees, creepers and men and maintains their continuity,

original: Vuṭṭhūpajīvino cete sattā sabbe, na ca mahāmeghassa ‘mayhete’ti apekkhā hoti.
analyzed: vuṭṭhu upajīvinaḥ ca ite sattā sabbe na ca mahā meghassa apekkhā hoti
translated: and although all these beings live on the rain, the great cloud has no expectation of ‘theirs’ or ‘mine,’

original: Evameva kho, mahārāja, tathāgato sabbasattānaṁ kusaladhamme janeti anupāleti, satthūpajīvino cete sattā sabbe, na ca tathāgatassa ‘mayhete’ti apekkhā hoti.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja tathāgataḥ sabba sattānam kusala dhamme janeti anupāleti satthu upajīvinaḥ ca ite sattā sabbe na ca tathāgatassa mayha ete iti apekkhā hoti
translated: even so, sire, the Tathāgata generates and maintains the wholesome states of all beings, and although all these beings live on the Teacher, the Tathāgata has no expectation of ‘theirs’ or ‘mine.’

original: Taṁ kissa hetu?
analyzed: tam kim sa hetu
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: Attānudiṭṭhiyā pahīnattā”ti.
analyzed: attā anudiṭṭhiyā pahīna ttā ati
translated: Because the view of self is abandoned.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, sunibbeṭhito pañho bahuvidhehi kāraṇehi, gambhīro uttānīkato,
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena su nibbeṭhitaḥ pañhaḥ bahuvidhehi kāraṇehi gambhīraḥ uttānīkato
translated: “It is good, revered Nāgasena, the question has been well unravelled by you with many reasons, the deep has been made shallow,

original: gaṇṭhi bhinno, gahanaṁ agahanaṁ kataṁ, andhakāro āloko kato, bhaggā paravādā, jinaputtānaṁ🔽cakkhuṁ uppāditan”ti.
analyzed: bhinnaḥ gahanam a gahanam andhakāraḥ āloko kataḥ bhaggā paravādā  cakkhum uppāditanti
translated: the knot has been untied, the thicket has been made clear, the dark has been made light, the arguments of others have been shattered,🔽and the eye of the sons of the Victor has been produced.”

original: Bhikkhusaṅghapariharaṇapañho sattamo.
analyzed: bhikkhu saṅgha pariharaṇa pañhaḥ sattamaḥ
translated: The seventh chapter.
